an6.98:1.1: “Mendicants, it’s totally impossible for a mendicant who regards any condition as permanent to accept views that agree with the teaching.
an6.98:1.2: Without accepting views that agree with the teaching, it’s impossible to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities.
an6.98:1.3: Without entering the sure path, it’s impossible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.
an6.98:2.1: It’s totally possible for a mendicant who regards all conditions as impermanent to accept views that agree with the teaching.
an6.98:2.2: Having accepted views that agree with the teaching, it’s possible to enter the sure path.
an6.98:2.3: Having entered the sure path, it’s possible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.”
